contents.markdown: As discussed in **Appendix C**, some nouns are formed by adding affixes to roots. If you do this with the prefix _pag_-, it creates a gerund, or a noun in the “-ing” form (eating, making, sleeping, etc.). Use these where a noun would be used in English, but not where a verb would be used.
Mahilig ako sa <u>pagluluto</u>. = I like <u>cooking</u>. “Cooking” is being used as a noun here, so a _pag_- noun is used in Tagalog.
<u>Nagluluto</u> ako. = I am <u>cooking</u>. “Cooking” is being used as a verb here, so a _pag_- noun is not used in Tagalog.
There are three variations of _pag_- nouns:
Variation 1: pag + kuha = pagkuha = pag + root
Variation 2: pag + la + lagay = paglalagay = pag + first syllable of root + root
Variation 3: pag+ ka + tuto = pagkatuto = pag + ka + root

In theory, the variation required depends on the affix of the verb you are making a gerund for. However, there are many rules and exceptions, so you are probably better off just memorizing complete _pag_- nouns as you encounter them. The sample sentences will only contain ones from the vocabulary list above.

item.tagalog: Naranasan ni Jessica ang pagtulog sa sasakyan.
item.english: Jessica experienced sleeping in the car.

item.tagalog: Naniniwala si Maria sa pagtuturo nang ganito.
item.english: Maria believes in teaching like this.

contents.markdown: When you put a gerund before a noun phrase, the following is good to keep in mind:
gerund + noun phrase (Tag.) = gerund noun phrase (Eng.)
**Notes: Indefinite noun phrases take _ng_ form. Definite noun phrases (possessive clause, personal pronoun, demonstrative pronoun or proper noun) take _sa_ form.**

item.tagalog: Mabilis ang paggawa sa gusaling yun.
Mahirap ang paglalagay ng mga puno sa kuwarto.
item.english: The placing of trees in the room is difficult.

item.tagalog: Masaya ako dahil sa pagkaalala ko sa Pilipinas.
item.english: I am happy due to (my) remembering the Philippines.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kanino mo sinabing nakakatuwa ang pagkuha ng sasakyan?
exampleSentences.english: Who did you say that getting a car is fun to?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Para sa paggawa ng adobo, paglulutuan ba natin ang kawali?
exampleSentences.english: For making adobo, will we (incl.) cook in the pan?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Bakit gustong-gusto ni Jessica ang pagtulog?
exampleSentences.english: Why does Jessica like sleeping very much?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nagpagawa ako ng adobo sa babaeng mahilig sa pagluluto.
exampleSentences.english: I had the woman who likes cooking make adobo.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Nalaman mo ba kung nakanino mahirap ang paglalagay ng mga ilaw?
exampleSentences.english: Did you find out at whose place the installing of lights is hard?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Pag-aaralan ni Analyn ang pagtuturo ng pangulo nang alas-sais ng umaga.
exampleSentences.english: Analyn will study the teachings of the president at 6am.

exampleSentences.tagalog: Gaano ba kahirap ang pagkaalala sa asawa niya para sa inyo?
exampleSentences.english: How difficult is the memory of her husband for you (pl.)?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Kumusta po ang pagkatuto sa anak ninyo sa taong ito?
exampleSentences.english: How is your child's learning this year? (resp.)

exampleSentences.tagalog: Paano siya naging ganun kasaya? Dahil ba sa pagkakita sa pusa?
exampleSentences.english: How did she become that happy? Is it due to seeing the cat?

exampleSentences.tagalog: Patulugin mo nga ang pagod sa pagkuha ng tanong.
exampleSentences.english: Have the one who is tired of taking questions go to sleep. (soft)
